content.description: This route begins in a seated position on the far right side of the boulder, between the wall and the tree. Hands begin matched on a wide, easy hand hold at about face level. Begin to traverse left to just past half way. Finish with a good hand hold on the top of the boulder and a heel hook out left at about shoulder height and top out.
content.location: Previous climbers have built rock piles near the boulders. Search the summit until you find the boulders. They are the largest on the summit. If you begin to go significantly downhill, you have left the summit.

content.description: Start on left most side of NW Boulder #1 and traverse until reach middle of boulder.   Move up middle and top out with a dyno move.
content.location: North west direction from summit rocks....the first of three in that particular clump.

content.description: Small boulder field ontop of Little Yellow Mountain.   Very secluded area...no trails lead to the top...so it's "find your own way" to the top.
